workflow.name: change_building_location
workflow.description: Change the building location

workflow.name: create_and_assign_thermal_zones_for_unassigned_spaces
workflow.display_name: Create and Assign Thermal Zones for Unassigned Spaces
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Create and Assign Thermal Zones for Unassigned Spaces
workflow.description: If any spaces are not part of a thermal zone, then this measure will create a new thermal zone and assign it to the space.

workflow.name: surface_matching_diagnostic
workflow.description: This will look for surfaces in adjacent spaces with similar geometry and create thermal connections between them.

arguments.display_name: Remove Duplicate Vertices in the Same Surface
arguments.name: remove_duplicate_vertices

arguments.display_name: Remove Collinear Vertices in the Same Surface.
arguments.name: remove_collinear_vertices

workflow.name: set_space_infiltration_by_exterior_surface_area
workflow.display_name: Set Space Infiltration by Exterior Surface Area
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Set Space Infiltration by Exterior Surface Area
workflow.description:
Replace all Space Infiltration objects with a new one that has a prescribed flow rate per exterior surface area.  There are many strategies that can be used to reduce infiltration.

Seal Windows ? Seal all windows and doors with weather strip and fill any air gaps with insulation and caulking to prevent air infiltration.

Install Revolving Doors on the Inner Door Entrance - Replace the high traffic entrance doors with revolving doors.  This will reduce the air infiltration associated with the doors.  Notice that loading dock doors and handicapped accessible entrances cannot be replaced with revolving doors.

Install an Air Curtain for the Loading Dock Door - An air curtain should be installed in the entryway of loading dock doors.  This will greatly reduce outside air from infiltrating during periods of time when loading dock doors are open.

Identify and seal other sources of infiltration ? Look for other uncontrolled infiltration sources and work to air seal.  These could be former electrical chases, abandoned HVAC ducting, general envelope deterioration, or many other sources.

arguments.display_name: Space Infiltration Flow per Exterior Envelope Surface Area (cfm/ft^2).
arguments.name: infiltration_ip

arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Costs for Building per Exterior Envelope Area ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_ip

arguments.display_name: O & M Costs for Construction per Area Used ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: om_cost_ip

argument.display_name: Skip Set Space Infiltration by Exterior Surface Area
argument.name: __SKIP__

variables.display_name: Skip Set Space Infiltration by Exterior Surface Area

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_electric_equipment
workflow.description: This measure removes all existing electric equipment from spaces recognized as office building space types. New electric objects will be added based on the 50% Small to Medium Office AEDG recommendations.

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_ip

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_electric_equipment_controls
workflow.description: This measure reduces the values associated with electric equipment schedules to simulate reductions due to equipment controls throughout the building. This includes occupancy based outlets or adapters, as well as network or timer based controls.

arguments.display_name: Total cost for all Electric Equipment Controls in the Building ($).
arguments.name: costTotal

workflow.name: add_electric_equipment_instance_to_space
workflow.display_name: Add Electric Equipment Instance to Space
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Add Electric Equipment Instance to Space
workflow.description: This measure allows you to create new electric equipment instance and assign it directly to a space in the model. It requires that the schedule and electric equipment definition already exist in the model. Additionally it has arguments for target space and multiplier

argument.display_name: Skip Add Electric Equipment Instance to Space
argument.name: __SKIP__

variables.display_name: Skip Add Electric Equipment Instance to Space

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_interior_lighting
workflow.description: This measure removes all existing lighting objects from spaces recognized as primary or secondary school space types. New lighting will be added based on the 50% Small to Medium Office AEDG recommendations.

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs for Lights per Floor Area ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_ip

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_interior_lighting_controls
workflow.description: This measure reduces the values associated with lighting schedules to simulate reductions due to vacancy sensors throughout the building.

arguments.display_name: Total cost for all Lighting Controls in the Building ($).
arguments.name: costTotal

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_fenestration_and_daylighting_controls
workflow.description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Small to Medium Office AEDG recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Daylighting Window Constructions ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_daylight_glazing

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed View Window Constructions ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_view_glazing

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Skylight Construction ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_skylight

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Exterior Shading Surface Construction ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_shading_surface

arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Light Shelf Construction ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: cost_light_shelf

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_exterior_wall_construction
workflow.description: This measure will modify existing exterior wall insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior wall construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass and metal walls if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increased, if not a new insulation layer will be added. For mass this will be at the exterior of the construction. For metal it will be added just behind the exterior layer. For steel and wood framed walls, insulation will be added to the exterior of the construction.

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Insulation was Improved ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_insulation_increase_ip

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_exterior_door_construction
workflow.description: This measure is intended for use on opaque doors; if doors are glass they should be treated as windows. OpenStudio does have a unique object for overhead doors versus standard doors. This measure doesn't alter infiltration. There is a separate measure for infiltration that includes user arguments for primary entry points.

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Insulation was Improved ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_insulation_increase_ip

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_roof_construction
workflow.description: This measure will modify existing roof insulation levels and Solar Reflective Index (SRI) values based on roof type and climate zone. The roof type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. If your model uses an attic, all attic surfaces should have an "Attic' intended surface type. For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Insulation was Improved ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_insulation_increase_ip

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Solar Reflectance Index (SRI) was Improved. ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_sri_increase_ip

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_interior_finishes
workflow.description: This measure will adjust the visible reflectance of materials used on interior building surfaces. Different target values will be set for floors, ceilings, and furniture/interior partition surfaces.

arguments.display_name: Only Check/Alter Interior Partition Surfaces To Meet Furniture Target When They Use This Construction.
arguments.name: object

arguments.display_name: Lower Height of Interior Partition Surfaces?
arguments.name: lowerPartitions

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_exterior_floor_construction
workflow.description: This measure will modify existing exterior floor (air exposed) insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior floor construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass floors if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increase or added at the inside of the floor. For steel and wood framed floors, insulation will be enhanced for an existing layer, or a new exterior layer will be added.

arguments.display_name: Increase Cost per Area of Construction Where Insulation was Improved ($/ft^2).
arguments.name: material_cost_insulation_increase_ip

workflow.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_exterior_lighting
workflow.description: This measure will create exterior lights objects in four different categories described below. The lighting levels and controls will be based on the "How to Implement Recommendations" section in the AEDG; any existing exterior lighting will be removed. A special input is needed for this measure to define the exterior lighting zone, which further describes whether the site is urban or rural.

arguments.display_name: Wall Coverage Area for Decorative Facade Lighting (ft^2)
arguments.name: facadeLandscapeLighting

arguments.display_name: Ground Coverage Area for Parking Lots and Drives Lighting (ft^2)
arguments.name: parkingDrivesLighting

arguments.display_name: Gound Coverage Area for Walkway and Plaza Lighting (ft^2)
arguments.name: walkwayPlazaSpecialLighting

arguments.display_name: Total cost for all Exterior Lighting ($).
arguments.name: costTotalExteriorLights

workflow.name: add_rooftop_pv
workflow.description: This measure will create new shading surface geometry above the roof for each thermal zone inyour model where the surface azmith falls within the user specified range. Arguments are exposed for panel efficiency, inverter efficiency, and the fraction of each roof surface that has PV

argument.display_name: Fraction of Surface Area with Active Solar Cells
argument.name: fraction_of_surface

variables.display_name: Fraction of Surface Area with Active Solar Cells
variables.display_name_short: Fraction of Surface Area with Active Solar Cells

workflow.name: aedg_office_swh
workflow.description: Measure replaces existing swh equipment (if any) with the swh equipment recommendations of the 50% Small and Medium Office AEDG.

workflow.name: set_thermostat_schedules
workflow.description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one

arguments.display_name: Choose Thermal Zones to change thermostat schedules on.
arguments.name: zones

arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs per Thermal Zone ($/thermal zone).
arguments.name: material_cost

workflow.name: nze_hvac
workflow.description: This measure replaces the existing HVAC system if any with the user selected HVAC system.  The user can select how to partition the system, applying it to the whole building, a system per building type, a system per building story, or automatically partition based on residential/non-residential occupany types and space loads.

workflow.name: create_baseline_building
workflow.description: Creates the Performance Rating Method baseline building.  For 90.1, this is the Appendix G aka LEED Baseline.  For India ECBC, this is the Appendix D Baseline.  Note: for 90.1, this model CANNOT be used for code compliance; it is not the same as the Energy Cost Budget baseline.

workflow.name: tariff_selection_flat
workflow.description: This measure sets flat rates for electricity, gas, water, district heating, and district cooling.

workflow.name: openstudio_results
workflow.description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.

workflow.name: envelope_and_internal_load_breakdown
workflow.description: Report provides annual and monthly views into heat gains and losses for envelope and internal loads.

options.name: Aurora
options.description: Option 11 Description: Change the building location

options.name: Create Zones
options.description: Option 1 Description: If any spaces are not part of a thermal zone, then this measure will create a new thermal zone and assign it to the space.

options.description: Option 1 Description: This will look for surfaces in adjacent spaces with similar geometry and create thermal connections between them.

For attics it doesn't matter what you put for "Standards Construction Type". The measure will check attic insulation where the attic is adjacent to other not attic spaces.

options.name: Int Finishes
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure will adjust the visible reflectance of materials used on interior building surfaces. Different target values will be set for floors, ceilings, and furniture/interior partition surfaces.

options.name: Ext Floor
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure will modify existing exterior floor (air exposed) insulation levels based on construction type and climate zone. The exterior floor construction type and climate zone should be set in the model prior to using this measure. For mass floors if an existing insulation layer can be found it will be increase or added at the inside of the floor. For steel and wood framed floors, insulation will be enhanced for an existing layer, or a new exterior layer will be added.

options.name: AEDG Office Ext Lighting
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure will create exterior lights objects in four different categories described below. The lighting levels and controls will be based on the "How to Implement Recommendations" section in the AEDG; any existing exterior lighting will be removed. A special input is needed for this measure to define the exterior lighting zone, which further describes whether the site is urban or rural.

options.name: Rooftop PV 75%
options.description: Option 2 Description: This measure will create new shading surface geometry above the roof for each thermal zone inyour model where the surface azmith falls within the user specified range. Arguments are exposed for panel efficiency, inverter efficiency, and the fraction of each roof surface that has PV

options.name: SWH
options.description: Option 1 Description: Measure replaces existing swh equipment (if any) with the swh equipment recommendations of the 50% Small and Medium Office AEDG.

options.name: Set Thermostats
options.description: Option 1 Description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one

options.name: NZE HVAC
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure replaces the existing HVAC system if any with the user selected HVAC system.  The user can select how to partition the system, applying it to the whole building, a system per building type, a system per building story, or automatically partition based on residential/non-residential occupany types and space loads.

options.name: create_baseline_building
options.description: Creates the Performance Rating Method baseline building.  For 90.1, this is the Appendix G aka LEED Baseline.  For India ECBC, this is the Appendix D Baseline.  Note: for 90.1, this model CANNOT be used for code compliance; it is not the same as the Energy Cost Budget baseline.

options.name: Tariff Flat
options.description: Option 1 Description: This measure sets flat rates for electricity, gas, water, district heating, and district cooling.

options.name: Results
options.description: Option 1 Description

options.name: Envelope and Internal Load Breakdown
options.description: Option 1 Description: Report provides annual and monthly views into heat gains and losses for envelope and internal loads.
